information.title: Overview
information.description: The Indian Constitution originally had 8 schedules. Currently, it has 12 schedules that contain provisions related to various aspects of governance and administration.

information.title: First Schedule
information.description: Lists the states and union territories of India and their territories.

information.title: Second Schedule
information.description: Contains provisions relating to the emoluments, allowances, and privileges of high constitutional dignitaries.

information.title: Third Schedule
information.description: Contains the forms of oaths or affirmations for constitutional positions.

information.title: Fourth Schedule
information.description: Allocates seats for each state and union territory in the Rajya Sabha.

information.title: Fifth and Sixth Schedules
information.description: Contain provisions for the administration and control of Scheduled Areas and Scheduled Tribes in states other than Assam, Meghalaya, Tripura, and Mizoram (Fifth), and in these four states (Sixth).

information.title: Seventh Schedule
information.description: Specifies the distribution of powers between the Union and the States (Union List, State List, and Concurrent List).

information.title: Eighth Schedule
information.description: Lists the 22 official languages recognized by the Constitution.

information.title: Ninth, Tenth, Eleventh, and Twelfth Schedules
information.description: Deal with land reforms and other laws (Ninth), provisions for disqualification of MPs and MLAs on grounds of defection (Tenth), powers and responsibilities of Panchayats (Eleventh), and Municipalities (Twelfth) respectively.

quizQuestions.question: The First Schedule of the Constitution lists the states and union territories of India.
The Ninth Schedule deals with powers and responsibilities of Panchayats.
The Second Schedule contains provisions relating to the emoluments and allowances of high constitutional dignitaries.
The Eleventh and Twelfth Schedules were added by the 73rd and 74th Constitutional Amendment Acts respectively.
The Third Schedule contains the forms of oaths or affirmations for constitutional positions.
